Characteristics: Mure proved this substance, and one symptom appears to be peculiar: "Taste of doughy bread in the mouth."
Mouth: Coppery taste with heat in throat when taking the drug.
Abdomen: Needle-like pain, intermitting in r. groin, in direction of joint, after walking.
Upper Limbs: Numbness of arm on which he lies; of hand and legs.
Lower Limbs: Frequent pain, now in l. buttock now in thigh.
